title: Coaching boundaries & consent
description: Clear agreements keep coaching safe, ethical, and useful. Review what we promise, what stays outside scope, and how we handle data.

whatYouGet.title: What you get
whatYouGet.description: When we coach together you can rely on:
items: Confidential, client-led conversations held in English, Mandarin, or both.
Collaborative experiments, reflections, and tools tailored to your goals.
Honest signposting if another professional or resource would support you better.
Written summaries of agreements so you stay in control of next steps.

whatWeDontDo.title: What we don’t do
whatWeDontDo.description: To respect coaching ethics, we do not:
items: Diagnose, treat, or provide therapy, counselling, medical, legal, or financial advice.
Complete immigration, tax, or legal paperwork on your behalf.
Guarantee job offers, promotions, or specific outcomes.
Work in situations where there is unmanaged risk of harm—we pause and refer instead.

sections.title: Informed consent & confidentiality
paragraphs: Before we begin we agree the purpose of coaching, session cadence, fees, and how notes are stored. You can ask questions or change your mind at any time.
Sessions stay confidential except where law or safeguarding duties require disclosure. If that ever becomes relevant we will discuss the steps together.

items.title: Data care
items.description: We keep minimal notes in encrypted storage, delete unused enquiries after 90 days, and review retention annually.

items.title: Sponsored coaching
items.description: If an employer funds coaching we outline what is shared (usually scheduling and attendance only) and what stays between coach and client.

sections.title: Scope of support
paragraphs: Coaching creates space to think, experiment, and design your own actions. It is future-focused and paced with your consent.
If clinical, legal, or crisis needs surface we will pause, name what we are noticing, and connect you with qualified specialists or community resources.

items.title: Referrals & signposting
items.description: We maintain a network of therapists, legal professionals, and peer groups. We can share options; you choose who to contact.

items.title: Between-session contact
items.description: Light check-ins by email or secure notes are available for accountability. Extensive support is scheduled as an additional session.

sections.title: Your choices
paragraphs: You decide what to share, which experiments to run, and whether to continue. Coaching should feel collaborative, not pressured.
If these boundaries do not fit your needs, let us know. We will help you find a different service without judgement.
